title: Grilled Shrimp with Melon & Pineapple Salsa
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Grilled Shrimp with Melon & Pineapple Salsan a try. One portion of this dish contains approximately 25g of protein, 9g of fat, and a total of 260 calories. This recipe serves 4 and costs $3.49 per serving. It will be a hit at your The Fourth Of July event. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian diet. 112 people were glad they tried this recipe. This recipe is typical of Mexican cuisine. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 1 hour and 15 minutes. Head to the store and pick up lime wedges, bell pepper, kosher salt, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the fresh ginger you could follow this main course with the Fresh Ginger Cookies as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 78%. This score is solid. Try Melon-Pineapple Salsa, Teriyaki Shrimp Burgers with Grilled Pineapple Salsa, Bacon and Blue Cheese, and Shrimp, Melon and Pineapple Kabobs for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. You could try Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.
